data.title: Council Bluffs Country Club
data.text:
John Bierbower – Head Golf Professional / Jerry Willer – Merchandise Manager Phone: 712-366-1639

Pro shop Hours effective 5/1/2024:

Monday……………..7:00 – Dusk

Tuesday……………..7:00 – Dusk

Wednesday…………7:00 – Dusk

Thursday……………7:00 – Dusk

Friday……………….7:00 – Dusk

Saturday…………….7:00 – Dusk

Sunday……………….7:00 – Dusk

Range is OPEN for the Season,

CLOSED at 6pm on Sunday & all day Monday

Stop in and take a look at the new offerings from Callaway, Taylormade, Cleveland, Srixon, and XXIO. Remember, if we do not have what you are looking for we can special order most product.

Lastly, we have a few friendly reminders as we get back into golf season: collared shirts are required, tee times are recommended, if you are not keeping up with the group in front of you please let the group behind you play through, fix your ball marks and divots, and have fun.

Remember to check and use your Shop Credit. As they say, Use it or Lose it.

–

Upcoming events – Member – Outside

August 25th – Annual Divorce Open

August 28th – Chamber of Commerce Brief Case Open

September 19th-20th – Annual Pro Member Tournament

September 22nd – St Alberts Alumni Fundraiser

September 23rd – Eastern NE Senior Golf Association Golf Outing

2024 Member / Member Champions

Congratulations to the team of Rob Krabbe and Doug Krasne for winning this year’s 2 day event. A Special Thank you to all that participated.

2024 Invitational Champions

Congratulations to Doug Waffle and his partner Scott Allen for winning this year’s 2 day event. After 2 days of perfect weather and a Derby of 18 teams they managed to out last Dick Hill and his partner Russ VanBelle on the last hole. Thank you Harold Diffey & his grounds crew for all they did to bring the course around and make CBCC very presentable and playable. Thank you to Paul Hyde for excellent meals and service provided by the Clubhouse staff. A Special Thank you to all that participated.

2024 Club Champions

The 2024 Club Championship ended with a thrilling playoff. Sean Davis battled back over the last round to force a playoff with Justin Hamilton. Justin and Sean tee’d off #1 for the first playoff hole with both players hitting great drives. Justin hit his approach to 15 feet and Sean was just short of the green. Sean setup for his third shot, a chip up the hill on #1 green, and chipped it in. Justin’s biride putt ran low and Sean was able to claim the 2024 Club Championship.

The Women’s flight was also a tight field with all the ladies having a shot to win after round 1 as Shirly Rochelle held the lead. As they played their second round, things started to fall in place for Megan Michalak and she was able to withstand the pressure over the final 18 holes and claim the title of 2024 Women’s Club Champion. Congratulations to Megan on her victory this weekend.

The Senior Flight was down to Rob Krabbe, Bob Mings, & Rick Dusek after round 1. On Sunday Rick Dusek played a great round and was able to overcome the field with a 141 and claim the Senior title. Congratulations to Rick on claiming the 2024 Senior Club Championship.

Congratulations to everyone and a Special Thank you to all that participated.

2024 Season Long Match Play

Bracket champions.

Bracket 1 – Rick Dusek

Bracket 2 – Todd Stover

Bracket 3 – Dick Hill

Bracket 4 – JD Culjat

Congratulations to the Bracket Champions

Bracket Playoffs.

Bracket 1 Dusek vs 4 Culjat – ????

Bracket 2 Stover vs 3 Hill – ????

2024 Match Play Championship.

Bracket 2/3 Stover/Hill vs Bracket 1/4 Dusek/Culjat – ????

Congratulations to ???? our 2024 Match Play Champion

2023 Pro Member

Congratulations to Golf Professional Justin Herron for the second year in a row. Justin was the top Pro in the 2 day event with a total of 134, followed by Jon Peterson with a 135. The overall team this year, Pat Duagherty, Colleen Brabec, & Jay Collins – 241 . Congratulations and Thank you to everyone for playing and your support. We specially thank all of the Sponsors this year for helping to make this one of the top events in the Omaha / Council Bluffs area.

2023 CBCC Cup Matches – NE vs IA

Unlike last years Cup Matches, this year NE (Captain Dr Tom Brandt) was able put on the crunch and took a lead after the first 18 holes, a team plan that IA (Captain Joe Poljanec) could not match up against. In the end after the singles matches NE hung on by 1 point and took home the trophy back to back. Thank you to everyone that played and made it a great event.
